body:
Flat 35 sec CD ability nerfed AP ratio by 50%
Im out.

replies.body:
1. Competitive play doesn't dictate champion balance. It's a factor to consider, but we believe it should be treated as just one element to think about. 

2. Master Yi has been used in competitive play.

3. This is a tooltip correction only. The actual ratio's been 0.15 for a long time.

while you´re here...care to give insight on the swain-nerfs in one of the two or three threads around? It seem´s...strange to put such a huge nerf on a champ that see´s very little play and isn´t seen as really unfair by most parts of the community - while champs that feature a very high banrate despite seeing not that much actual sucess like yasuo because they´re highly frustrating to face don´t get addressed like...ever.

We've felt Swain's been borderline too strong for a long time, but his low play and ban rate have been a deciding factor in leaving him as is and keeping an eye on him. We're now seeing him perform really well post preseason changes, so feel we need to take some power off him. Current thinking (still going through testing, so not a locked change yet), is that as a sustained damage, drain mage-tank, that CC's the best strength to hit, hence the change to Nevermove so it's got a lower duration at lower ranks.

>We've felt Swain's been borderline too strong for a long time, but his low play and ban rate have been a deciding factor in leaving him as is and keeping an eye on him.

How about Lee Sin or Yasuo, who've been too strong (nothing borderline about it) for longer with a high P/B rate. 

Why is he getting nerfed over these champions?

'CC's the best place to hit'

Okay sure, the immobile mage who has absolutely horrible times CSing without at least ten to twenty games of practice (reminder, literally anyone else this bad is a support, has great waveclear with spells or has a ridiculous auto modifier) gets out-traded with anyone with burst, who is actually weaker mid and late after his Zhonyas gets popped because Marksmen just got buffed, and even does all of his jobs **less than other mages,** especially {{champion:112}}  and {{champion:63}}. He is getting nerfed so that he now has even _less answers to melee champions_ (and, by the way, his kit's set up so he's supposed to be bullying, **if you forgot**) and less ways of ensuring his Decrepify damage hits for it's full duration, which is actually a lot of his early-game damage. Oh, and we're not even getting into his **Mana Costs...** 

If you want to look at an ability to nerf, Torment still has **Damage Amplification** even though you made drastic changes to anyone with a DFG, but Swain has one of those built into a basic ability that's also a damage over time effect that has ludicrous synergy with Deathfire Touch.

I love Swain as a character. I have roleplayed him for a year and a half now. I love him, but his inability to offer anything someone else can't do better ultimately frustrates me, coupled with the fact he has not gotten a skin almost as long as {{champion:85}} and **at least Kennen has a lot of skins to choose from.** Historically his last buff, not universal buffs like when you nerfed armor or the recent mana increases, **buffs focused on him to do anything positive,** was back in October, **2013.** He has since been ignored a great deal, between Rioters dancing around Dragonmaster Swain and saying he's always in an 'Okay' position. Only recently were we told he's going to be targeted for some changes, and those are being thrown on the back burner right now and **we have no date or even general idea when they are coming.**

At least tell us the Rework is coming after Taric, because Gods Know his kit may have been interesting back in '09, but it doesn't hold a candle to any mage today.

I am a main Swain, so i may be not impartial. 

First Swain isn't strong at all against long range push/poke/farm ap champ (azir, lux, Viktor ...who were overly present last season) but yeah these guys just got kinda nerfed so Swain is coming back recently on the rift, thanks to ROA buff too. 
You are cutting one of his strength and you listed his others (sustained damage, drain mage-"tank", with CC), but this guy has serious drawback too :
- He has no spell/tool to help him last it like a lot of champs now have (DOT aren't the best for that). Moreover he has one of the lowest ad and one of the weirdest AA animation.
- He has no pushing power at all, unless u empty your mana pool on one single creep wave (at least early). Thus his ability to roam is bad. It also mean a weaker wave clear later to defend against siege.
- He has no mobility. DOTs can be good but it's countered by heal/shield/regen etc.. contrary to burst (but his DOTs damages aren't stronger to compensate) 
- This guy need to buy too much stats. If you want to use Swain full potential (his sustain and damages from R at a low range) you need :
{{summoner:32}} Tankiness (your kit don't give you any) so HP to avoid being burst (otherwise sustain is useless) and Armor/MR to enhance sustain efficiency. This make Swain BAD if behind cause he won't be able to use his play style.
{{summoner:32}} Mana pool and/or regen (passive not enough once you have ult)
{{summoner:32}} Damages, cuz yeah your an ap carry
So HP/Armor/Mr/Mana/AP/Mpen while for instance, current Graves just need damages while fighting at same range as Swain. His E giving him up to 120 Arm/Mr for an adc, and bloodlust mastery giving him sustain.

I don't wanna say that this nerf is not justified or that Swain is overly weak now but he has several drawbacks for a midlaner. He has a lot of strengths and lot of people don't know how to deal with him or underestimate the stacked DOTs damages (RIP E+ignite nerf though) but this is compensated by all these things I listed above. I DO HOPE this nerf won't come without any compensation because his W snare is his only way to engage with his lack of mobility (especially against long range ap who already can outpush him without much counter play), and enemies are still able to hit him while he engages that way. Moreover Deathfire touch might be nerfed too.

Hope these arguments will be taken into account. For Beatrice sake, CAW !

You counter argued it very poorly. My point was not contradicted even once, let alone refuted.

There is no justification for the Rammus nerf, your argument of "Well, it doesn't even matter because he will taunt anyway" is trash on the lines of ; "Well, let's remove 50% of Lee's base AD because he uses skills to do damage anyway, right?" that would be unjustified  and the 'counter argument' would be trash.

Furthermore, Rammus is grossly underpowered, the only reason he is seeing some play and success is BECAUSE of the massive prevalence of AD, this is the one time where it is valid to say "It is because of the meta" because Riot themselves nerfed mages and tanks across the board while heavily buffing ADC leading to a very AD heavy meta, making strict anti AD champions better picks. Rammus' nerf is 100% unjustified.

The point me and the other guy was making was that they were shaving away power from spots that will hurt him the least? It's not nerfing Lee's base ad by half, its like taking away Lee's ministun on his ult (the small one that roots the target in place BEFORE the kick.) because that isn't his main strength. 

They're not nerfing his "attack me and die" power, they're slightly taking off a small amount of his stickyness. It's like trimming a branch that is in the way than chopping down the tree.

For the sake of arguement, i'd like to know why you think Rammus is underpowered. Rammus has always been a niche champion because his thing is to punish autoattackers. So when he begins to live in a meta where his niche is realized and appreciated, is it too much to consider that he is doing TOO well in his niche?

Food for Though.

> [{quoted}](name=Light24o1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bdyFGEFc,comment-id=0008000400000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-25T03:30:31.598+0000)
>is it too much to consider that he is doing TOO well in his niche?

Yes. It is too much to consider; He is doing his job reasonably well, thriving in an environment of massive overpowered ADC. To nerf him when he is only doing exactly what he was designed to do is unjustified.

But to ask you the same question; Do you consider nerfing underpowered characters to be a reasonable action? Yes/No


Remember that Yasuo, Lee, Thresh, Alistar and Riven were very popular in worlds and have consistently outperformed their peers (Ex: Urgot, Skarner, Galio, Sona, Warwick, etc.). Rammus being decent at doing exactly what is designed to do but getting nerfs.... is a slap in the face when you realize that the overpowered champions have been doing infinitely better across the board rather than in a VERY specific scenario.

This is getting slightly irritating. You keep focusing on a single argument while ignoring the rest. Rammus HAS NOT been nerfed in his Niche. He HAS had power taken away from a less pivotal aspect of him. His niche has remained untouch, while giving ANYONE, not just adcs, a bit more breathing room while trying to get away from him. 

Also, the idea of underpowered here is being rather different from our point of view. You think Rammus is underpowered outside of his niche. That is literally what Rammus is. He is such a Niche, an Anti-Auto Attacker champ, that he provides little else of use other than a single target cc, and if you want that, you're better off picking Sion, Naut, or other Cc tanks. 

What you're asking, is to buff every non-niche part of him, to move him from his Niche. To make him viable against non-auto attackers teams, would require a full blown rework. All of Rammus is to F**k over auto attackers. That's his niche. To make him Viable outside his NIche, would make his Auto Attacker Niche, even MORE powerful.

The solution to things isn't just to "buff" underplayed champs. They have very real problems built INTO their kit, that isn't as simple as to just buff some numbers
